title: Convolution-t Distributions
abstract: arXiv:2404.00864v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: We introduce a new class of multivariate heavy-tailed distributions that are convolutions of heterogeneous multivariate t-distributions. Unlike commonly used heavy-tailed distributions, the multivariate convolution-t distributions embody cluster structures with flexible nonlinear dependencies and heterogeneous marginal distributions. Importantly, convolution-t distributions have simple density functions that facilitate estimation and likelihood-based inference. The characteristic features of convolution-t distributions are found to be important in an empirical analysis of realized volatility measures and help identify their underlying factor structure.

translated_abstract: 我们介绍了一类新的多元重尾分布，这些分布是异质多元t分布的卷积。与常用的重尾分布不同，多元卷积t分布体现了具有灵活非线性依赖性和异质边缘分布的簇结构。重要的是，卷积t分布具有简单的密度函数，有助于估计和基于似然的推断。发现卷积t分布的特征在实现波动率测量的经验分析中非常重要，并有助于识别其潜在因子结构。
tldr: 提出了一种新的多元重尾分布，即卷积t分布，具有灵活的非线性依赖性和简单的密度函数，可在实现波动率测量的分析中发挥重要作用。
en_tdlr: Introduced a new class of multivariate heavy-tailed distributions, convolution-t distributions, with flexible nonlinear dependencies and simple density functions, which are important in the empirical analysis of realized volatility measures.
